https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AHC-UK;db868c9c.1502 Just a reminder that the voting for DH Awards 2014 is ongoing<br>(and close in some categories!) so you should remember to<br>encourage people to look at the list of nominated DH resources<br>and vote at http://dhawards.org/dhawards2014/voting before the<br>end of *28 February 2015*.<br><br>Anyone is allowed to vote, even your parents or next door<br>neighbours; tell that institutional mailing list, person in the<br>supermarket, or stranger you meet on a bus. (They will think you<br>are weird, but if more people see the DH resources we produce,<br>then everyone wins.) Versions of this announcement in French<br><http://dhawards.org/dhawards2014/voting-announcement-french/>,Japanese<br><http://dhawards.org/dhawards2014/voting-announcement-japanese/>andSpanish<br><http://dhawards.org/dhawards2014/voting-announcement-spanish/>are available<br>from the website.<br><br>Digital Humanities Awards are a set of entirely open annual<br>awards run as a DH awareness raising activity. The awards are<br>nominated and voted for entirely by the public. These awards are<br>intended to help put interesting DH resources in the spotlight<br>and engage DH users (and general public) in the work of the<br>community.
